comment.author: 39839593@N00
comment._content: Didn't mr. Flanagan have a phone or had he already left this premises?

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/govert1970] Would have thought he'd have had a phone. Will try some directories earlier than 1969...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: I was working in the area around that time and I cannot for the life of me remember Flanagans.  I exptec that the youngsters were either on their way to Aughrim Street to the church or to Stanhope street convent but I imagine that they were on their way from Stanhope St.  As a long time admirer of the mini-skirt I would see nothing profane about them Stefano!

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] One of our Facebookers knows the Flanagans, and is checking their address at the time (the business is still on the go), but from memory, he thought it was Halston Street. However, Halston Street is so altered, it's impossible to tell - so we'll have to wait to hear from the Flanagans, still Cutler Engineers!
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 68394391@N08
comment._content: This shoot is smashing! Thanks for sharing. I have my grandmother's first communion photo taken in 1936.

comment.author: 7265804@N05
comment._content: Thoms Dublin Street Directory for 1962-3 lists 'Flanagan, James, cutler engineer' at 3 Halston Street.
